titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania LJS 194: Geometria

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts LJS 194: Geometria are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of geometrical texts, including material from four chapters of the Isagoge geometriae; correspondence with Adelbaldus (also known as Adelbold or Albaldus, of Utrecht) about the area of isosceles triangles; and a treatise on the construction of astrolabes. Annotated in the 12th century and also by an unknown late 15th- or early 16th-century humanist who collated the text with other manuscripts and noted the classical sources in the text.

msItem.title: Sections from the first four chapters of Isagoge geometriae, f. 1r
Letter from Gebert to Adelbaldus on the area of triangles, lacking beginning, f. 49r
Response from Adelbaldus to Gebert, f. 51v
Treatise on construction of astrolabe, f. 53v

supportDesc.extent: 56 leaves : 155 x 106 (121 x 78) mm. bound to 163 x 113 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Parchment, i (18th-century paper) + 56 leaves + i (18th-century paper); 1-7⁸; one gathering lacking after gathering 6 and perhaps some material at end also lacking; modern foliation in pencil, [1-56], upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 24-25 long lines; ruled in drypoint.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in romanesque book script by two hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: Geometric diagrams throughout; 4 large (3-line to 10-line) white-vine initials in red ink (f. 1r, 2r, 5r, 8r), 1 zoomorphic 5-line initial formed from a winged dragon (f. 7r), and 1 5-line initial drawn in brown ink (f. 22v); 1-, 3-, and 4-line painted initials in red throughout; some capitals touched in red; rubrics in red; a few manicules early in the manuscript (f. 2r-5v).
Zoomorphic initial, Initial S, Dragon, f. 7v

binding.p: 18th-century blind-stamped calf; rebacked with spine laid on; GEOMETRIA written on head edge. Some loss to marginal notes and diagrams due to trimming.

origin.p: Written in Bavaria, probably in modern northern Austria, in the mid-12th century.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by M. Haimmiller (inscription, f. 1r).
Formerly owned by Hieronymus Wilhelm Ebner von Eschenbach, sold at auction in Nuremberg as part of his library, 2 Aug. 1813, lot 311.
Formerly owned by John Bohn and then Sir Thomas Phillipps (Ms. 4437, label on spine).
Formerly owned by Harrison D. Horblit (Ridgefield, Conn.).
Appeared in H. P. Kraus' cat. 155 (1979), no. 18; also handled by book and manuscript dealer Bruce Ferrini (Akron, Ohio); also appeared in Sam Fogg Ltd. cat. 14 (1991), no. 1.
Formerly owned by John D. Stanitz (Cleveland, Ohio), Ms. 25.
Acquired by Lawrence J. Schoenberg with other Stanitz manuscripts, Sept. 1997.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2011.
